description: They are harvested when young and before the white bulb has time to form properly and are tender and mild with a long white slender neck and hollow green tops. Spring onions are milder than onions so can be eaten raw in salads and sandwiches. The green tops can be used like chives, as a garnish or sliced in salads or stir fries.What to look forLook for solid white bulbs with white root hairs firmly attached, and crisp, bright green stems.AvailabilityAll year.StoreRefrigerate in plastic bags in the crisper.How to prepareTrim root end and dark green leaves, wash well, slice thinly or into short lengths.Ways to eatThe entire onion, including the top, can be sliced and used raw in salads, as a garnish or cooked in stir fries. Spring onions are often used in Oriental cooking. Cut the green tops very finely and use like chives. Spring onions can be used instead of onions in some recipes.
name: Spring Onion Eschallot bunch
